Peace Lily.additional_notes: Will 'faint' if moisture < 40; no direct sun.

Monstera.additional_notes: Moss pole for climbing; chunky aroid mix.

Bird of Paradise.additional_notes: Heavy feeder; needs bright direct light.

African Violet.additional_notes: Bottom water; avoid leaf contact with water.

String of Pearls.additional_notes: Sandy soil; rocks/grit; no standing water.

Alocasia Polly.additional_notes: High humidity; pebble tray or humidifier.

Monstera Adansonii.additional_notes: Swiss Cheese Vine; requires trellis or moss pole; sensitive to draft.

Spider Plant.additional_notes: Produces 'pups' on runners; sensitive to fluoride in tap water.

Prayer Plant.additional_notes: Leaves fold at night; high humidity essential; avoid direct sun.

Parlor Palm.additional_notes: Low light tolerant; sensitive to over-fertilizing.

Jade Plant.additional_notes: Prune to encourage trunk growth; avoid wet leaves.

Calathea Ornata.additional_notes: Pinstripe plant; extremely sensitive to tap water chemicals.

Blue Star Fern.additional_notes: Epiphytic; likes chunky bark mix; blue-green foliage.

Cast Iron Plant.additional_notes: Virtually indestructible; handles low light and drafts easily.

Polka Dot Begonia.additional_notes: Angel wing variety; stakes needed for height; silver spots.

Aloe Vera.additional_notes: Medicinal sap; let soil dry completely between watering.

String of Hearts.additional_notes: Trailing succulent; avoid overwatering tubers; likes bright light to keep variegation.

Swiss Cheese Plant.additional_notes: Requires moss pole for climbing; leaves develop more holes with better light.

Watermelon Peperomia.additional_notes: Sensitive to salt buildup; avoid getting leaves wet; compact growth.

Rubber Tree.additional_notes: Large waxy leaves; needs wiping to remove dust; sap is a skin irritant.

Chinese Money Plant.additional_notes: Rotate weekly for even growth; produces pups; hates direct hot sun.

Nerve Plant.additional_notes: Dramatic 'fainter' when dry; excellent for terrariums; needs consistent humidity.

Croton.additional_notes: Needs high light for color; drops leaves if moved; keep away from drafts.

Asparagus Fern.additional_notes: Actually a lily relative; has hidden thorns; tiny leaves drop when dry.

African Mask Plant.additional_notes: High humidity; pebble tray; keep warm; dormant in winter.

Flamingo Lily.additional_notes: Waxy flowers; needs high light to bloom; sensitive to cold.

Elephant Ear.additional_notes: Huge leaves; bog plant; loves water; needs plenty of space.

Blue Star Fern.additional_notes: Epiphytic; likes chunky bark mix; unique blue-green color.

Boston Fern.additional_notes: Prone to leaf drop if dry; loves bathrooms; avoid drafty spots.

Heartleaf Philodendron.additional_notes: Very hardy; trails or climbs; great for beginners.

Zebra Plant.additional_notes: Yellow flower spikes; picky about water quality; hates drying out.

Yucca Cane.additional_notes: Pointy leaves; very drought tolerant; can grow very tall indoors.

Sago Palm.additional_notes: Not a true palm; extremely toxic to pets; slow grower.

Money Tree.additional_notes: Often sold with braided trunk; rotate for even foliage; avoid overwatering.

Lady Palm.additional_notes: Fan-shaped leaves; slow growing palm; handles low light well.

Wax Plant.additional_notes: Fragrant waxy flowers; succulent-like leaves; climbs or trails.

Burro's Tail.additional_notes: Extremely fragile leaves drop at touch; trailing growth; avoid high humidity.

Blue Columnar Cactus.additional_notes: Stunning blue hue; requires intense light to maintain color; keep bone dry in winter.

Ponytail Palm.additional_notes: Succulent trunk stores water; slow grower; non-toxic to pets.

Staghorn Fern.additional_notes: Epiphytic; usually mounted on wood; requires frequent misting or soaking.

Kimberly Queen Fern.additional_notes: More sun-tolerant than Boston fern; upright growth; less messy.

Rattlesnake Plant.additional_notes: Spotted leaves with purple undersides; leaves move up at night; dislikes tap water.

African Milk Tree.additional_notes: Not a cactus; contains toxic milky sap; very fast-growing succulent.

Dragon Tree.additional_notes: Slender leaves with red edges; handles low light; sensitive to fluoride.

Coffee Plant.additional_notes: Shiny dark green leaves; loves high humidity; can produce berries after 3-4 years.

Hoya Kerrii.additional_notes: Heart-shaped leaves; slow grower; single-leaf cuttings rarely grow a stem.

Dumb Cane.additional_notes: Toxic sap; variegated large leaves; avoid direct afternoon sun.

Chinese Evergreen.additional_notes: One of the most reliable low-light plants; handles dry air well.

Lipstick Plant.additional_notes: Red tubular flowers; epiphytic nature; likes bright indirect light to bloom.

English Ivy.additional_notes: Vigorous climber; prone to spider mites in dry air; likes cool spots.

Creeping Fig.additional_notes: Tiny leaves; fast climber with aerial roots; keep consistently moist.

Moon Valley Pilea.additional_notes: Deeply textured crinkly leaves; compact; excellent for terrariums.

Flaming Katy.additional_notes: Succulent leaves; vibrant blooms; requires bright light to rebloom.

Desert Rose.additional_notes: Succulent trunk (caudex); needs intense light; toxic sap; beautiful blooms.

Crown of Thorns.additional_notes: Spiny stems; blooms throughout the year; drought tolerant.

Purple Heart.additional_notes: Deep purple foliage; fast grower; trails nicely; color fades in low light.

Calathea Medallion.additional_notes: Iconic prayer plant movement; very sensitive to chlorine and fluoride in water.

Swiss Cheese Vine.additional_notes: Rare collector plant; extremely high humidity needs; more hole than leaf.

Satin Pothos.additional_notes: Silver variegated leaves; leaves curl when thirsty; slower than regular Pothos.

Majesty Palm.additional_notes: Demanding palm; needs high light and constant moisture; prone to spider mites.

String of Turtles.additional_notes: Tiny succulent-like leaves; patterns resemble turtle shells; avoid soggy soil.

Elephant Bush.additional_notes: Succulent shrub; leaves are edible; great for bonsai training.

Frost Peperomia.additional_notes: Silvery ripple leaves; very sensitive to cold; compact growth.

Kimberly Queen Fern.additional_notes: More sun-tolerant than Boston fern; upright growth; less messy foliage.

Panda Plant.additional_notes: Fuzzy, silver-blue leaves with brown tips; avoids leaf rot by keeping dry.

Flaming Sword.additional_notes: Bands on leaves; keeps central cup filled with fresh water; flowers once.

Rex Begonia.additional_notes: Known for intense foliage colors; rhizomatous; avoid direct sun and wet leaves.

Waffle Plant.additional_notes: Deeply textured purple leaves; 'faints' quickly when dry; great for air purification.

String of Fishhooks.additional_notes: Fast-growing succulent vine; banana-shaped leaves; extremely drought tolerant.

Silver Dragon Alocasia.additional_notes: Silvery, thick leaves with dark veins; sensitive to overwatering; likes tight pots.

Earth Star.additional_notes: Terrestrial bromeliad; foliage turns pinker with more light; needs airy soil.

Variegated Boxwood.additional_notes: Often used for indoor topiary; needs cool winters; dislikes wet feet.

Bird's Nest Fern.additional_notes: Wavy fronds emerge from central rosette; avoid watering directly into the center.

Swiss Cheese Fern.additional_notes: Texture looks like crumpled paper; very durable fern; handles low light.

African Spear.additional_notes: Cylindrical leaves; extremely hardy; often sold braided; very slow grower.

Elephant's Ear Philodendron.additional_notes: Large spade-shaped leaves; climbs; requires support; easy care.

Moth Orchid.additional_notes: Epiphytic; grow in bark/moss; roots turn silver when thirsty; do not water crown.

fertilizer.notes: Do not use soil fertilizer; feed live insects only

Venus Flytrap.additional_notes: Requires distilled water/rain only; dormant in winter; no traditional soil.

fertilizer.notes: Occasional insect in pitchers; avoid root fertilizer

Pitcher Plant.additional_notes: Vining habit; pitchers need water inside; sensitive to minerals in tap water.

Pencil Cactus.additional_notes: Toxic milky sap; turns orange/red in high light; extremely drought tolerant.

Elephant's Ear.additional_notes: Massive leaves; requires heavy watering; space-consuming.

Fire Flash.additional_notes: Bright orange stems; related to spider plant but no runners; sensitive to salts.

Zebra Cactus.additional_notes: Slow grower; white horizontal stripes; handles lower light better than most succulents.

Whale Fin Sansevieria.additional_notes: Single giant leaf; architectural; extremely hardy; avoid overwatering at base.

Cigar Cactus.additional_notes: Unique spiral growth; architectural; keep dry during winter months.

String of Pearls Curio.additional_notes: Round leaves; extremely sensitive to overwatering; bottom watering recommended.

Jewel Orchid.additional_notes: Terrestrial; grown for foliage (velvety dark red); avoid direct sun.

Cape Primrose.additional_notes: Related to African Violet; long bloom season; avoid water on leaves.

Hoya Crimson Queen.additional_notes: Pink/white variegation; waxy flowers; succulent-like care.

String of Dolphins.additional_notes: Dolphin-shaped leaves; hybrid; sensitive to overwatering; needs bright light.

Polka Dot Plant.additional_notes: Spotted foliage; pinch back to keep bushy; colors fade in low light.

Copper Spoon.additional_notes: Felted cinnamon-colored leaves; architectural; slow growing.

Living Stones.additional_notes: Do not water during 'splitting' phase; requires inorganic grit; mimics desert pebbles.

Variegated Monstera.additional_notes: Slower than non-variegated; white areas prone to browning; needs high indirect light.

Philodendron Pink Princess.additional_notes: Climbing; stakes/moss pole needed; light intensity determines pink variegation.

Stingray Alocasia.additional_notes: Unique leaf tail; requires significant vertical space; spider mite magnet.

Fishbone Cactus.additional_notes: Epiphytic cactus; night-blooming fragrant flowers; likes more water than desert cacti.

Blue Oil Fern.additional_notes: Iridescent blue foliage; extremely high humidity; keep away from all direct sun.

Dragon Scale Alocasia.additional_notes: Hard, textured leaves; prone to root rot if moisture > 80; keep warm.

Friendship Plant.additional_notes: Deeply textured bronzy leaves; handles lower light; easy to propagate.

Mistletoe Cactus.additional_notes: Epiphytic jungle cactus; trailing cylindrical stems; tiny white berries.

Persian Shield.additional_notes: Iridescent purple foliage; needs warmth and consistent moisture; pinches for bushiness.

Cebu Blue Pothos.additional_notes: Silver-blue elongated leaves; fenestrates as it climbs; very fast grower.

Fireball Bromeliad.additional_notes: Turns bright red in high light; produces stolons to form colonies; keep tank filled.

Dancing Bones Cactus.additional_notes: Segmented stems; yellow/orange flowers; avoids wet feet in winter.

Crested Euphorbia.additional_notes: Coral-like mutation; usually grafted onto a rootstock; extremely drought tolerant.

Pink Quill.additional_notes: Can be grown in air or well-drained soil; hot pink bract with purple flowers.

Copper King Mammillaria.additional_notes: Copper-colored spines; forms clumps; very sensitive to winter overwatering.

String of Spades.additional_notes: Leaves shaped like spade suits; darker than String of Hearts; trailing.

African Blood Lily.additional_notes: Spectacular pom-pom flowers; dormant in winter (stop watering); toxic if eaten.

Ficus Audrey.additional_notes: Velvety leaves; easier than Fiddle Leaf Fig; avoid drafts and sudden temperature drops.

Desert Privet.additional_notes: Ruby-red leaf undersides; taco-shaped leaves; keep water out of leaf windows.
